Posts.Title: What does scar tissue feel like? brady0819 LoveWell
Mother won't allow a biopsy. ClareatRisk CoolBreeze

Posts.Content: Jun 8, 2010 03:44AM LoveWell wrote: Clare, I'm sorry your mom is being so... "close-minded" is a good word, I think.  But it's understandable.  The chance of it being cancer is extremely low, plus she's your mother and she lost her sister from this, so she's of course reluctant to admit this could be happening to her daughter.  To be honest, I myself am a hypochondriac.  It's driven my parents crazy on more than one occassion lol xD  But at the same time, that's what led me to finding my lump and doing something about it so soon.  It's good that you're concerned too. But I really don't know what to tell you about making her see this your way.  You're only 17, so you can't make the appointment by yourself, and the doctor's office can call your house and inform your mom about it without telling you.  All I can say is keep pushing her.  Give her statistics and facts and figures.  Do anything you can.  What's important is YOUR health and YOUR peace of mind. Sending you prayers and good thoughts.  Fingers crossed everything turns out okay :)
Posts.Title: Mother won't allow a biopsy. ClareatRisk CoolBreeze

Posts.Content: Jun 7, 2010 04:20AM LoveWell wrote: I'm 18, and we are in almost the same boat.  I found a lump in my right breast on Tuesday and am now awaiting ultrasound results to confirm or deny my doctor's suspicion that it's a cyst.  The truth is, since we are so young, it's infinitely more likely that our lumps are benign.  You more than likely have nothing to worry about.  However, just because your last biopsy came back clear of cancer does NOT mean this one is the same.  This is one reason why younger women die of breast cancer more often than older women; we can be put off from diagnosis because of the "age bias" - we're so young, so parents and even doctors just assume that no matter what, we can't possibly have cancer, so they don't take us as seriously.  It's not true.  We can get breast cancer, it's just rare.  I don't know about you, but I'm not taking any chances.  Thankfully, my parents are on the same page as me, and from all the research I've done, I honestly believe that I have a benign cyst or fibroadenoma and not a cancerous tumor.  Odds are, it's the same for you. But don't take the chance.  It's never worth it.  Demand a biopsy, no matter what your mom says.  If your doctor reccomends it, that's even more reason to get it.  Let's hope that both of us fall into the majority and get benign diagnoses :) ~ Love
Posts.Title: Mother won't allow a biopsy. ClareatRisk CoolBreeze
